page.title: 01Oban & Surrounding Hills
page.content: Oban is a small town built round a bay. There are many hotels and guesthouses because Oban is a tourist centre. The main street consists of shops and restaurants. There is a sandy beach and an old castle to the North. In the centre there is a railway station and piers for fishing, pleasure boats, and ferries to the islands. Oban faces an island, kerrera, sheltering the bay, and rises onto hills all around, crowned by a large stone circular monument called McCaig's Tower. There is a live-stock market centre for the islands and surrounding farms. Housing estates have been built on the hillsides on the outskirts of the town. There are five cottage hospitals and one small industrial estate. oban has a new self-righting lifeboat. On the pier there is a fishermans mission.
